windows.symptom: Can I change a setting in Windows 10 to make a PC start up automatically when power becomes present?        I have found that when my PC is manually turned off at the plug socket (without shutting down via Windows) and then turned back on, it won't start up again automatically. I need to press the power button on the PC to start it up again. Is there a change that I can make to the PC itself (or in Windows 10) to make it start automatically as soon as power becomes present?
solutions: Hi BWP_239 The method you are using to shut down your PC can and most probably will at some point corrupt your Windows 10 installation, that is not a safe way to shut down a PC . . .There is no setting to start your PC when power is restored to your PC, because once Window is shut down, your PC needs to apply power to the power board, then BIOS will POST and finally WIndows will begin loading and that can only be done by pressing the power button on the casing of your PC . . .

When they want the machines to come back on, they should just have to turn the plug socket power back on. We previously obtained PCs from a company where this worked, but we recently got PCs from a new supplier, and these new PCs won't turn on automatically like the original ones did. The customers would need to open up the machines and press the power button to restart the PCs (which we want to avoid at all costs). I wanted to check if we could change a setting in Windows or BIOS to add this functionality back in.

"Is there a change that I can make to the PC itself (or in Windows 10) to make it start automatically as soon as power becomes present? "This setting must be done in BIOS if your PC support that feature.Setting options could be something like:- AC Power ON, Stay Off- AC Power ON, Turn On- AC Power ON, Previous state.

Hi BWP_239 If there is a setting for the PC to boot when power is applied, then that setting would be specific to the PC and you will find that in BIOS under power options, that will definitely not be a Windows setting . . .

Find the program called "Asus Smart Gesture" and select from the top the buttonrepair or right clic and select the option repair. You might have to restart your notebook but you're basically done. Hope this helps...

Visual problem with certain apps        A few weeks ago maybe even 2 month ago I started having the problem that some of my apps start to get like a visual glitch. I don't know how to describe it but I'm including a picture. It always happens with apps that are dark like Discord, Atom, Visual Studio Code. I haven't been able to figure out what it is but I'm sure somebody has the same problem and would be happy to find this with some information about how to fix it.
solutions: Hello oOsoulsingerOo, I am Andrew an independent advisor. I see in your screenshot the Windows taskbar is not affected. Have you tried updating the drivers for your hardware via the manufacturer? Go to your PCs manufacturer website and be sure video display drivers are most recent. If this continues after this please let us know. Take Care, Andrew

Yes I have already updated, rolled back to drivers were I didn't have but it didn't change. It usually only happens in apps like the PTB of discord or today when I installed Visual Studio Code for the first time. The glitching is also only visibal when I'm using the app or in the case of Discord when I'm connected to a channel and I have it running on my second screen.

One thing I forgot to mention is that I am using a Windows Insider Program OS build. But I manage to fix it by updating my OS to 19536.1000 I now can't use Wallpaper Engine but I at least know that I'm not the only person that is having a problem and I can live without Wallpaper Engine for some time ^^.
